channel.id: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: An upstart stock-car driver (Tom Cruise) goes to the edge for his manager (Robert Duvall), his brain-surgeon girlfriend (Nicole Kidman) and himself.(n)

programme.title: Baby Geniuses
programme.desc: Evil partners (Kathleen Turner, Christopher Lloyd) experiment on an infant and send his twin to a reputable research nursery.(n)

programme.title: Three to Tango
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman (Dylan McDermott) and his mistress (Neve Campbell) believe the architect (Matthew Perry) looking out for her is gay.(n)

programme.title: The Lazarus Effect
programme.desc: A medical researcher (Mark Duplass) and his team develop a serum that brings the dead back to life, but things go horribly wrong after they use it on his newly deceased fiancee (Olivia Wilde).(n)

programme.title: Born Free: A New Adventure
programme.desc: Two American teens (Jonathan Brandis, Ariana Richards) in Africa try to teach a lion cub one raised to survive in the wild.(n)

programme.title: Juwanna Mann
programme.desc: Banned from the NBA, a basketball player (Miguel A. Núñez Jr.) dresses in drag in order to play in a woman's league.(n)

programme.title: The New Guy
programme.desc: In jail, a teenager (D.J. Qualls) meets another inmate who shows him how to act cool at his high school.(n)

programme.title: Guarding Tess
programme.desc: A Secret Service agent (Nicolas Cage) is reassigned to protect a defiant former first lady (Shirley MacLaine) at her Ohio home.(n)

programme.title: Stand by Me
programme.desc: A boy (Wil Wheaton) and his three buddies set out in the summer of 1959 on a hike to find a dead body.(n)

programme.title: Copycat
programme.desc: A criminal psychologist (Sigourney Weaver) helps two detectives (Holly Hunter, Dermot Mulroney) trail a killer whose crimes mirror those of infamous mass murderers.(n)

programme.title: Blue Velvet
programme.desc: A young man (Kyle MacLachlan) ties the mystery of a severed ear to a roadhouse floozy (Isabella Rossellini) and her tormentor (Dennis Hopper).(n)

programme.title: Night Passage
programme.desc: A former railroad man (James Stewart) guards a payroll shipment, and his younger brother's (Audie Murphy) gang robs it.(n)

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.(n)

programme.title: Born Losers
programme.desc: Part-Indian foot fighter Billy Jack (Tom Laughlin) defends coeds against outlaw bikers in a California town.(n)

programme.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Part 2
programme.desc: A retired Texas Ranger (Dennis Hopper) pursues a killer named Leatherface (Bill Johnson) and his family of chainsaw-wielding cannibals.(n)

programme.title: Sleepaway Camp 2: Unhappy Campers
programme.desc: A summer-camp slasher returns, after a sex change, as a female counselor (Pamela Springsteen) who kills.(n)

programme.title: Sleepaway Camp 3: Teenage Wasteland
programme.desc: Slasher Angela (Pamela Springsteen) is back, posing as a camper, at Herman's (Michael J. Pollard) camp for those of mixed means.(n)

programme.title: The Blood on Satan's Claw
programme.desc: A judge (Patrick Wymark) tries to stop a witch named Angel (Linda Hayden) and her coven of children in 17th-century England.(n)

programme.title: The Believers
programme.desc: A police psychologist (Martin Sheen) and his son (Harley Cross) discover a sacrificial cult in New York.(n)

programme.title: I Bury the Living
programme.desc: The chairman (Richard Boone) of a cemetery thinks a person dies when he moves their pin on a plot chart.(n)

programme.title: Swimming Upstream
programme.desc: An Australian lad (Jesse Spencer) becomes a swimming champion while dealing with his bitter, alcoholic father (Geoffrey Rush).(n)

programme.title: The Naked Street
programme.desc: A reporter follows the story of a gangster (Anthony Quinn), his sister (Anne Bancroft) and her small-time hoodlum husband (Farley Granger).(n)

programme.title: Big House, U.S.A.
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Reed Hadley) sends a kidnapper (Ralph Meeker) to prison, then goes after him when he escapes with cellmates.(n)

programme.title: The Wild Party
programme.desc: An ex-football brute (Anthony Quinn) and his beatnik gang take a rich girl (Carol Ohmart) and her boyfriend hostage (Arthur Franz) at a jazz joint.(n)

programme.title: Crime of Passion
programme.desc: A tough newswoman (Barbara Stanwyck) tries to help her detective husband's (Sterling Hayden) career by dallying with his police boss (Raymond Burr).(n)

programme.title: Nightmare
programme.desc: A New Orleans police detective (Edward G. Robinson) helps his brother-in-law, a jazz musician (Kevin McCarthy) haunted by a dream of murder.(n)

programme.title: A Bullet for Joey
programme.desc: Recruited for a kidnapping, a deported gangster (George Raft) ends up busting a Communist spy ring for a Mountie (Edward G. Robinson).(n)

programme.title: The Big Knife
programme.desc: A Hollywood movie star's battle with a studio chief leads to a downward spiral of alcohol, blackmail and death.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bird Cage
programme.desc: Women rebel against slave labor in a filthy jungle prison where they feed sugar cane to a mechanical maw.(n)

programme.title: The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
programme.desc: Fed-up baseball players (Billy Dee Williams, James Earl Jones, Richard Pryor) form their own team and barnstorm the country in 1939.(n)

programme.title: Fear City
programme.desc: An ex-boxer turned talent agent (Tom Berenger) hunts a sick martial artist out to rid Manhattan of strippers.(n)

programme.title: Number One With a Bullet
programme.desc: A suave Los Angeles detective (Billy Dee Williams) and his quirky partner (Robert Carradine) hunt a drug lord who has social clout.(n)

programme.title: Black Mama, White Mama
programme.desc: A hooker (Pam Grier) and a radical (Margaret Markov) escape from a brutal Philippine prison, chained together.(n)

programme.title: Black Girl
programme.desc: An aspiring dancer (Peggy Pettit) and her wicked sisters resent their mother's love for a foster daughter (Leslie Uggams).(n)

programme.title: The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
programme.desc: Fed-up baseball players (Billy Dee Williams, James Earl Jones, Richard Pryor) form their own team and barnstorm the country in 1939.(n)

programme.title: Death Rides a Horse
programme.desc: A young man (John Phillip Law) hunts his parents' killers with a veteran gunfighter (Lee Van Cleef) who has something to hide.(n)

programme.title: The Wild, Wild West
programme.sub-title: The Night of the Flaming Ghost
programme.desc: West sets out to stop a megalomaniac descendant of John Brown who is determined to take over the United States.(n)

programme.title: The Wild, Wild West
programme.sub-title: The Night of the Grand Emir
programme.desc: West and Gordon must protect a visiting despot from assassination despite his disregard for his own safety.(n)

programme.title: Harry Tracy
programme.desc: The last survivor (Bruce Dern) of Butch Cassidy's gang turns the century with an artist (Michael C. Gwynne) and a judge's daughter (Helen Shaver).(n)

programme.title: The Great Missouri Raid
programme.desc: An Army major (Ward Bond) hunts Frank and Jesse James (Wendell Corey, Macdonald Carey), partners with the Younger brothers after the Civil War.(n)

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: Bat Masterson (George Montgomery), Doc Holliday (James Griffith) and Wyatt Earp rescue a framed rancher and stop an Indian war.(n)

programme.title: Cattle Annie and Little Britches
programme.desc: Two teenage girls (Amanda Plummer, Diane Lane) rally what's left of the Doolin-Dalton outlaw gang after Doolin (Burt Lancaster) is caught.(n)

programme.title: The Jayhawkers
programme.desc: A vengeful farmer (Fess Parker) brings down an empire builder (Jeff Chandler) in pre-Civil War Kansas.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
programme.desc: A college professor (Richard Gere) forms a lasting bond with a dog that he finds on a train platform.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Warren Miller's Timeless
programme.desc: A look at the enduring spirit of winter and a deserving nod to the past seven decades of ski cinematography.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Oddball
programme.desc: A chicken farmer and his granddaughter train a dog to protect a penguin sanctuary from foxes.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Hansel and Gretel
programme.desc: A witch (Cloris Leachman) locks a woodcutter's children (Hugh Pollard, Nicola Stapleton) in her gingerbread house.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Wheely
programme.desc: In a world where cars are citizens, an underdog cabbie named Wheely tries to become king of the road of Gasket City. Animated.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild
programme.desc: A friendly skunk helps a little mouse (Michael J. Fox) rescue a cat from a dreaded forest creature. Animated.(n)

programme.channel: USA: Starz Kids And Family FHD
programme.title: Monkey Kingdom
programme.desc: A South Asian monkey named Maya welcomes a son into her extended family and is determined to give him a leg up in the hierarchy of their complex society.(n)
